fxInfo_notes: Until 2003, countries whose combined average ratings for Political Rights and Civil Liberties fell between 1.0 and 2.5 were designated "Free"; between 3.0 and 5.5 "Partly Free", and between 5.5 and 7.0 "Not Free". Since then, countries whose ratings average 1.0 to 2.5 are considered"Free", 3.0 to 5.0 "Partly Free", and 5.5 to 7.0 "Not Free".
fxInfo_sources: Freedom House (2018). Taken from Teorell et al (2018).
name: e_fh_status
